Events that occurred on 5 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1959 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to William Ready.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Eileen Elgar (see Letter 255) and encloses the manuscripts Concerning ... 'The Hoard' and Kinship of the Half-elven.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 294a.
1971 - Voice actor Yuri Lowenthal is born.
1983 - Actor Owain Arthur is born.
2004 - The first day of "RingCon IV" in Seattle.
2015 - Artist and linguist Tom Loback dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
Wormtongue reaches Isengard at morn.
Théoden and company reach Isengard at noon. They have a parley with Saruman and camp at Dol Baran.
Pippin looks into the Orthanc-stone and a short time later a winged Nazgûl passes over the camp. In response, Gandalf sets out with the Hobbit for Minas Tirith.
Frodo hides in sight of the Morannon, and leaves at dusk.
